rev.desc.rev.desc: Remove reference to edit.array. Also removed all unreachable panels, which was most of them.
The last change was missing $ml.qry on the check.mail panel.
Added the following process line to the start panel:
$ml.qry="user.to=\"broadcast\" or user.to=\""+operator()+"\" or user.to=\""+$lo.ufname+"\""
Changed the query on the check.mail panel to:
$ml.qry
Stubbed to use read mail.

Set the bad validation exit on send.mail.messages to decide.return. That is, if a message does not get sent because of a bad validation, do not send out a message indicating that the messages was sent.
Changed must.enter.subject exit from get.text.msg.rio to get.text.msg.

Changed the way the subject line is validated: on denull.user.array, added expression $L.void=strtrmr(subject in $ml) so that strings like " " will get trimmed to ""; on decide.users.assign, changed condition from null(subject in $ml) to nullsub(subject in $ml, "")="". Changed send.fax.msg to set date.to.send in $ml to tod(). Changed get.text.msg to set date.to.send in $ml to NULL - this panel gets called on a failed validation so it makes sense to clear the date here.
Set date.to.send in $ml to tod() on denull.user.array.
added an exit to the decide.users.assign panel to not allow the user to continue if there is no subject
Added balloon help messages in rio panel.
changed workflow so the back exit on sending mail takes you back to intermediate mail menu, as well as entry will take you to intermedaite menu even if u have no mail to read.
In panel check.mail, changed the query to include a check for the operator's full name in addition to the ID.

Removed all settings of "user.from in $ml=operator()" from panels clear.mail.record.1, denull.user.array, set.init.variables.0, and set.init.variables.1 and instead, set it to "user.from in $ml=$me". Called the subroutine us.mail.user.from to set $me.
Validate the group for scmail and email.
scmsg
Deleted lines on set.init.variables.0 and set.init.variables.1 that hardcode date.to.send in $ml to the mail open date.
Fixed the condition for the validate.assign exit on the decide.users.assign panel. Should be option()=2.
Set user.from in $ml=operator() before creating the schedule records.
Took "date.to.send in $ml=$now" statement out from clear.mail.record.1 panel

descript.descript: Remove reference to edit.array. Also removed all unreachable panels, which was most of them.
The last change was missing $ml.qry on the check.mail panel.
Added the following process line to the start panel:
$ml.qry="user.to=\"broadcast\" or user.to=\""+operator()+"\" or user.to=\""+$lo.ufname+"\""
Changed the query on the check.mail panel to:
$ml.qry
Stubbed to use read mail.

Set the bad validation exit on send.mail.messages to decide.return. That is, if a message does not get sent because of a bad validation, do not send out a message indicating that the messages was sent.
Changed must.enter.subject exit from get.text.msg.rio to get.text.msg.

Changed the way the subject line is validated: on denull.user.array, added expression $L.void=strtrmr(subject in $ml) so that strings like " " will get trimmed to ""; on decide.users.assign, changed condition from null(subject in $ml) to nullsub(subject in $ml, "")="". Changed send.fax.msg to set date.to.send in $ml to tod(). Changed get.text.msg to set date.to.send in $ml to NULL - this panel gets called on a failed validation so it makes sense to clear the date here.
Set date.to.send in $ml to tod() on denull.user.array.
added an exit to the decide.users.assign panel to not allow the user to continue if there is no subject
Added balloon help messages in rio panel.
changed workflow so the back exit on sending mail takes you back to intermediate mail menu, as well as entry will take you to intermedaite menu even if u have no mail to read.
In panel check.mail, changed the query to include a check for the operator's full name in addition to the ID.

Removed all settings of "user.from in $ml=operator()" from panels clear.mail.record.1, denull.user.array, set.init.variables.0, and set.init.variables.1 and instead, set it to "user.from in $ml=$me". Called the subroutine us.mail.user.from to set $me.
Validate the group for scmail and email.
scmsg
Deleted lines on set.init.variables.0 and set.init.variables.1 that hardcode date.to.send in $ml to the mail open date.
Fixed the condition for the validate.assign exit on the decide.users.assign panel. Should be option()=2.
Set user.from in $ml=operator() before creating the schedule records.
Took "date.to.send in $ml=$now" statement out from clear.mail.record.1 panel
